basics.name: Dustin Hlava
basics.label: Front-End Web Developer
basics.summary: My name is Dustin Hlava and I am a front-end web developer in Austin, TX. I have a passion for writing clean, fast, and efficient HTML, CSS, and JavaScript using modern web programming techniques and tools. I have designed, developed, and deployed numerous large web sites and applications. While my passions lie in front-end development, I have developed a broad web technology skill set which I am always eager to grow.

work.name: United Airlines
work.position: Senior Web UI Developer/Manger of Web App. UI Development
highlights: Architected, developed, and launched the next-generation United.com
Established front-end architecture and coding standards across United’s ecommerce applications
Engineered and developed (full-stack) numerous large, high-impact products and feature enhancements to United’s ecommerce applications
Worked side-by-side with team members in various company roles (leadership, business development, design, marketing, testing) to design and refine the application user experience

Responsible for the remediation of United.com to meet the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0 AA guidelines and was a team recipient of the 2017 Access Award by the American Foundation for the Blind
Successfully fostered the transformation of United eCommerce software development from traditional waterfall to agile using extreme programming methodologies
Implemented and maintained automated continuous delivery servers (GoCD and TeamCity) to enable continuous integration and continuous delivery of new United.com products and features
Practiced test-driven development (TDD) and integrated multiple levels of the testing pyramid (unit tests, integration, functional/UI) into the United.com continuous delivery pipelines

work.name: Hartigen Solutions, LLC

Developed using the latest and greatest CSS and JavaScript features while falling back gracefully in less capable browsers
Worked directly and effectively with team members in all other company roles (leadership, sales, design, testing) to design and refine the application user experience

projects.name: Arrow Electronics
projects.description: While an employee of the User Interface team at Arrow Electronics, a Fortune 200 distribution company, I provided critical front-end web development for their North American and global eCommerce platforms. Over my two years at Arrow, I was part of a team that successfully launched five large, complex web applications, relaunched all previously existing eCommerce applications, and developed Arrow's core UI/UX guidelines based on web standards, performance optimization, and usability.

projects.name: Purdue Manurfacturing Extension Partnership
projects.description: After a period of substantial growth, the Purdue Manufacturing Extension Partnership (MEP) had outgrown their web presence as a micro site within the Technical Assistance Programs umbrella. As an independent site, MEP could more effectively share their services, economic impact, success stories, and upcoming events with potential clients. The new site featured notable improvements to site navigation, usability, and search engine optimization.

projects.name: Indianapolis Coalition for Patient Safety
projects.description: The Indianapolis Coalition for Patient Safety is a non-profit partnership of health care leaders committed to advancing patient safety. IndyPatientSafety.org improved upon their previous site with a refreshed design, improved site structure, and the additional of several new features. A new members-only portal provided logged in members access to a document sharing library, administration pages, and an organizational directory.

projects.name: Indiana Pharmacy Compare
projects.description: Indiana Pharmacy Compare, a collaboration between Purdue University and the Pharmacy Quality Alliance, is one of five nationwide projects designed and developed to deliver secure, web-based performance reports for participating pharmacies. The site gave pharmacies the ability to access and view their individual performance reports. These reports contained rating scores for a list of performance measures and allowed them to compare their scores to other pharmacies in the area.

projects.name: Purdue Center for Regional Development
projects.description: A full redesign for the Purdue Center for Regional Development giving their site a clean professional design, enhanced site navigation and organization, and under-the-hood updates to allow self-service updates to content.

projects.name: Hoosier Heartland Small Business Development Center
projects.description: This site gave the Hoosier Heartland Small Business Development Center their first presence on the web. The site that I developed for them clearly provided potential clients with a list of the services provided, success stories, upcoming events, as well as an easy way for those clients to contact the center for further engagement.

projects.name: Quality Environmental Professionals Inc.
projects.description: Web site redesign as part of QEPI's marketing update initiative. The redesign provided a fresh and modern (at the time) look and drastically imporoved site organization and usability.

projects.name: Egg of the Apocalypse: The Big Eye Bill Chronicles
projects.description: Bill, a crime fighting egg with a giant eye, must stop the evil villain banana, Chiquito, from robbing the city's largest bank. This 3D animated short was created as part of a small team of students while attending Purdue University. It received two awards: "1st Place Animation" in the 2006 Purdue Digital Cinema Contest and the "Most Entertaining" award in the 2006 Spring Show of the Purdue SIGGRAPH (Special Interest Group for Graphics) chapter.

projects.name: The Travels of Bob the Bacterium
projects.description: The Travels of Bob the Bacterium is one part in an episodic series of educational stories used to teach Indiana's elementary school students about agricultural concepts. In collaboration with the Purdue University Agronomy Department and the other members of my senior project group at Purdue University, this story was transformed from its original printed format to an interactive 3D animation.

projects.name: X-wing Rendering
projects.description: Created as part of my coursework at Purdue University, the goal was to recreate a single frame from a movie using 3D modeling and rendering tools. I think you may be able to guess the movie.

projects.name: Nintendo Illustration
